title: Srimad Bhagavad-gita - Chapter 6 Recitation | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | ISKCON Bangalore Sanga
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The initial verses of Chapter 6 are recited, focusing on the principles of yoga, self-control, and detachment from material desires as paths to spiritual elevation.
Verses describing the process of meditation, proper posture, and controlling the mind to achieve peace and attain the supreme destination are recited.
The recitation emphasizes the importance of moderation in eating, sleeping, and activities, highlighting how yoga can alleviate suffering and lead to transcendental happiness.
The verses discuss the process of detaching from desires, controlling the mind, and seeing all beings with equality, leading to the highest perfection in yoga.
Arjuna expresses doubt about controlling the restless mind, and Krishna explains the importance of practice and detachment, assuring that one who strives for self-realization never faces degradation.
